context: The Finnish word 'jätä' is an imperative form of the verb 'jättää', which means to leave something behind, abandon, or not take something with you. It's used when telling someone to leave something in a place. In other forms, it can mean to not stay (as in 'en jäänyt' - I didn't stay) or to postpone/leave for later (as in 'jätän tämän tehtävään huomiseksi' - I'll leave this task until tomorrow).
